DataElement.preferredName: Gastrointestinal Not Kaposi Sarcoma Disease Assessment Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free text field to specify or explain why the gastrointestinal symptoms are not related to Kaposi Sarcoma.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Gastrointestinal Not Kaposi Sarcoma Disease Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to an assessment of gastrointestinal (the stomach and intestines) disease not related to Kaposi Sarcoma (a malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells).

ObjectClass.preferredName: Gastrointestinal Not Kaposi Sarcoma Diseases and Disorders
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (GAS-tro-in-TES-tih-nul) GI.  Refers to the stomach and intestines.:An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin however, it may also occur internally.  It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS).:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the stomach and intestines.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.

A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin; however it may also occur internally. It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS).

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
